text: Waldemar Kaminski (July 23, 1917 near Albany, New York – June 21, 2006, Buffalo, New York) was a grocer and anonymous philanthropist in Buffalo. After his death, it was revealed that he had anonymously given millions of dollars to Buffalo charities over the years. Kaminski was a first sergeant in the United States Army from 1941–46, responsible for training new soldiers. He ran a food stand in Broadway Market, Buffalo for more than 50 years. ==References== * Category:1917 births Category:2006 deaths Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Philanthropists from New York (state) Category:Businesspeople from Buffalo, New York Category:Activists from New York (state) Category:20th-century philanthropists
